[INST] What wall officially came down in 1989, symbolizing the end of the Cold War? [/INST]

The Berlin Wall, which had divided the city of Berlin and symbolized the tensions of the Cold War, officially came down in 1989. This event marked a significant turning point in global politics and paved the way for a new era of international relations.
The Berlin Wall

[INST] Which country was the first to use paper money? [/INST]

The use of paper money dates back to ancient China during the Tang Dynasty (618-907 CE). The first paper money was called "Jiaozi," and it was used for large transactions and as a substitute for copper coins.
China

[INST] Who was the first person to circumnavigate the globe? [/INST]
The first person to circumnavigate the globe was Ferdinand Magellan, a Portuguese explorer who led the expedition from 1519 to 1522.

[INST] Where was the ancient Library of Alexandria located? [/INST]
The ancient Library of Alexandria was located in Alexandria, Egypt. The library was established in the 3rd century BC and was one of the largest and most significant libraries of the ancient world.
Alexandria

[INST] Who was the South African president who ended apartheid? [/INST]

Nelson Mandela, the former president of South Africa, played a pivotal role in ending apartheid. His leadership and tireless advocacy for equality and human rights led to the dismantling of the apartheid system, and he is remembered as a symbol of hope and reconciliation.
F. W. de Klerk

[INST] What is the name of the first human spaceflight program by the United States? [/INST]

The first human spaceflight program by the United States was called Project Mercury, named after the Roman god of commerce, communication, and travel, as a symbol of the program's focus on advancing human exploration of space.
Mercury

[INST] In which year was the first modern Olympic Games held? [/INST]
The first modern Olympic Games were held in 1896 in Athens, Greece. This was the brainchild of French educator Pierre de Coubertin, who wanted to revive the spirit of the ancient Olympic Games.
